title: Recent acquisitions of Asian Art part II
short_description: This exhibition features some of the most exciting new acquisitions made by the Asian Art Department over the last couple of years. Featured are a schist reliquary from Pakistan c. A.D. 200, a 19th-century Korean screen decorated with auspicious subjects and symbols, and contemporary Japanese ceramics. Vietnamese porcelain, Nepalese manuscript covers, and an Indian sandstone sculpture of a cow suckling a calf round out the select group of works.

input: Recent acquisitions of Asian Art part II
